body_content.explanation: to join or stick together to form a larger mass or group, or to cause something to do this:
examples: Tiny carbon particles can cause damage in the lungs since they can agglomerate there.
Throughout this time, political leaders have been steadily agglomerating powers.

body_content.explanation: to combine different companies to form one organization:
examples: Management experts warn that mergers often do not work well, so why are CEOs so eager to agglomerate?
Most of these small companies are in the process of being agglomerated with other financial institutions.

body_content.explanation: rock or material consisting of different pieces that are bonded (= joined and held) together:
examples: Volcanic agglomerate is one type of pyroclastic rock (rock formed from fragments of lava ejected from a volcano).
To meet the increasing demand for detergents to be able to release oxygen at lower temperatures, a totally new agglomerate has been invented.

body_content.explanation: a mass or collection of things:
examples: Galaxies are huge agglomerates of stars, gas, and dust.
Small businesses are being consolidated into large agglomerates.
